      • writeFofn

        public static void writeFofn(@ReadOnly File destination,
             List<@ReadOnly File> files)
                      throws IOException
        Takes a list of files and writes it as a "File of file names" (i.e. a file with one filepath on each line) to the destination file, overwriting the destination file if it exists. Note the filepath used is the absolute filepath
        Parameters:
        destination - The fofn file we are writing. This file will contain newline separated list of absolute file paths
        files - The files to write to the destination file
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeFofn

        public static void writeFofn(@ReadOnly File destination,
             File... files)
                      throws IOException
        Takes a list of files and writes it as a "File of file names" (i.e. a file with one filepath on each line) to the destination file, overwriting the destination file if it exists. Note the filepath used is the absolute filepath
        Parameters:
        destination - The fofn file we are writing. This file will contain newline separated list of absolute file paths
        files - The files to write to the destination file
        Throws:
        IOException
